summary: Burkholderia pseudomallei is a Gram-negative bacterium found in water and wet soils of endemic areas bordering the equator. the organism infects most mammals and causes the disease melioidosis in humans [1-10] melioidosis commonly affects the lungs. burkholderia mallei is a non-motile, host-adapted clone of B. pseudomallei. it causes the highly contagious zoonotic disease glanders, which affects horses, mules, and donkeys. disease progression and pathology in humans and horses are similar. the most commonly used surrogate to study B. pseudomallei and B. pseudomallei is the mouse. intranasal inoculation mimics the natural route of aerosol infection for human disease. intranasal inoculation results in a significant proportion of the inoculum remaining in the nasal passages. the aim of this study was to develop a non-invasive, rapid, reproducible, practical, and safe aerosol delivery method to study the pulmonary form of glanders and melioidosis in BALB/c mice.
